@graph.caption: Easy Cinnamon Swirl Quick Bread - Super easy to make, very forgiving, it's a quick homemade version of your favourite cinnamon bread! www.recipetineats.com

@graph.name: Easy Cinnamon Bread (No Yeast!) | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: An Easy Cinnamon Bread that's made with no yeast. Moist and gorgeously buttery! Super quick batter to make, and the smell while it's baking is outrageous!

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Easy Cinnamon Bread
@graph.description: Recipe video above. Easy to make, this easy Cinnamon Swirl Quick Bread is made without yeast! It's super moist - and stays moist for days afterwards - it tastes buttery and you get gorgeous pockets of sweet sticky cinnamon sugar!

recipeInstructions.text: Grease a loaf tin approximately 21 x 11 cm / 8" x 4" and line with baking paper, leaving overhang (see video).
recipeInstructions.name: Grease a loaf tin approximately 21 x 11 cm / 8" x 4" and line with baking paper, leaving overhang (see video).

recipeInstructions.text: Place Dry Ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Place Dry Ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Place Wet Ingredients in a separate bowl and whisk until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Place Wet Ingredients in a separate bowl and whisk until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Place Cinnamon Sugar ingredients in a bowl and mix to combine (it should be like a slurry, see video).
recipeInstructions.name: Place Cinnamon Sugar ingredients in a bowl and mix to combine (it should be like a slurry, see video).

recipeInstructions.text: Make a well in the Dry Ingredients bowl. Pour in Wet Ingredients, then mix 12 - 15 times until just combined (few lumps ok, see video).
recipeInstructions.name: Make a well in the Dry Ingredients bowl. Pour in Wet Ingredients, then mix 12 - 15 times until just combined (few lumps ok, see video).

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon about 1/4 of the batter into the tin (about 1.5cm / 3/5" deep) and smooth surface.
recipeInstructions.name: Spoon about 1/4 of the batter into the tin (about 1.5cm / 3/5" deep) and smooth surface.

recipeInstructions.text: Dollop about 1/3 of the Cinnamon Sugar over the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Dollop about 1/3 of the Cinnamon Sugar over the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with half the remaining batter. Dollop the remaining Cinnamon Sugar over the batter. Drag a butter knife back and forth (lengthwise and cross wisto make the swirls. Top with remaining batter - dollop it on, the more the Cinnamon Sugar is moved about, the more swirls!
recipeInstructions.name: Top with half the remaining batter. Dollop the remaining Cinnamon Sugar over the batter. Drag a butter knife back and forth (lengthwise and cross wisto make the swirls. Top with remaining batter - dollop it on, the more the Cinnamon Sugar is moved about, the more swirls!

recipeInstructions.text: Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Then remove and cover with foil, and bake for a further 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Then remove and cover with foil, and bake for a further 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
